comment.author: 25825879@N05
comment._content: The large square building top right is the Jezreel's Tower built by followers of the messianic James Rowland White in the 1880s. The Tower was a local landmark until it was demolished in 1961. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jezreel%27s_tower

comment.author: 86905786@N02
comment._content: This is taken from the north side of the River Medway at Upnor. The three large dock basins are still there and separate the green space to the left known as St. Mary's Island from the "mainland". The whole area is now known as Chatham Maritime since it has been redeveloped after the Royal Navy moved out in the 1980's. To the right many of the Iron grey buildings still stand and are in use and the red brick buildings are part of the 3 Universities who have facilities here. I know because I have lived on the Island for 16 years....
